questions.question: Faraday's laws of electrolysis are related to the

explanations.a: Faraday's laws do not relate to atomic number but to the amount of substance deposited.
explanations.b: Atomic number isn't used directly in Faraday’s law.
explanations.c: Speed of cation does not determine quantity deposited.
explanations.d: Correct. Faraday’s laws relate to the equivalent weight. Learn more

questions.question: With increasing voltage, the sequence of deposition of metals on the cathode will be:

explanations.b: Correct. Metals with higher reduction potentials deposit first. Details here
